alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 3:51PM EST until January 02 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. .Antecedent soil moisture and upwards of an additional one inch of rainfall this weekend has returned the Mississinewa River to flood. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Water on the shoulder and edge of SR 1 south of the junction with SR 28 in western Randolph County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EST Saturday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 8.8 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening.
